meanings.definition: A device used to measure changes in volume or dimensions of a substance.
meanings.sent1: The dilatometer showed how the liquid expanded when heated.
meanings.sent2: Scientists used the dilatometer to study how metals change size with temperature.
meanings.sent3: The dilatometer decided to take up yoga to measure its own flexibility.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was a dilatometer, expanding with each new discovery.
meanings.sent5: The dilatometer hummed softly as it recorded the substance's volume changes.

meanings.definition: A tool that determines thermal expansion or contraction of materials.
meanings.sent1: The dilatometer indicated that the metal rod expanded when heated.
meanings.sent2: Engineers rely on the dilatometer to understand how materials react to temperature changes.
meanings.sent3: The dilatometer joked with the thermometer about who could measure temperature changes better.
meanings.sent4: His heart was a dilatometer, shrinking with each disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The dilatometer's readings were as clear as a bell, showing the material's thermal behavior.
